loader.loadingDesc: Hold on a moment, we’re setting things up for you…

uploadPhoto.title: How to choose photos for upload
uploadPhoto.description: A guide on lighting, background, and positioning to help you choose the right photos

modal.title: How to choose photos for upload
modal.description: The better the photos you upload, the better your product visuals will look. Follow these tips to get great results.
modal.disclaimerText: Our AI works best with clear photos of products. It may struggle with small details and text labels (like, beauty products). And the product may appear slightly different in each visual. We’re working on improving accuracy and consistency. But if you notice issues in the generated images, we recommend trying again.
modal.whatPhotosWorkBestText: Photos that are sharp, well-lit, and show the product from different angles work best. Here are a few examples:
modal.howManyPhotos: How many photos should I upload?
modal.howManyPhotosTextThree: of your product to get the most accurate results. The minimum is 10, and the maximum is 25.
modal.tipsForQualityOneAnswer: Take photos of the front, back, and both sides. Include shots from above, below, and at angles (25–75 degrees).
modal.tipsForQualityTwoAnswer: A white or light backdrop works best. Avoid decorations or patterns.
modal.tipsForQualityThreeAnswer: Make sure your product is the only focus of the photo. If other objects are in the frame, our AI might think they are part of the product and blend them together.
modal.tipsForQualityFourAnswer: Take close-ups shots to show intricate details for products like jewelry and accessories.
modal.tipsForQualityFourAnswerTwo: Include a scale shot with everyday objects for size reference.
modal.tipsForQualityFiveAnswer: For clothing or footwear, take photos of the product in use (like on a mannequin or a person).
modal.tipsForQualitySixAnswer: Natural light works best, but soft, diffused artificial light is also fine. Avoid harsh shadows or glare.
modal.tipsForQualitySevenAnswer: Use the best quality your camera or smartphone allows. Turn off the flash and use RAW or high-resolution JPG settings.
modal.photoFormatQuestion: What photo formats can I upload?
modal.photoFormatAnswer: You can upload photos in these formats:

one.question: What do I write in the description?
one.answer:
Use our templates to help describe your scene.

For the photo shoot, try this format:

[The product] positioned [on the platform], surrounded by [flowers], [forest] in the background, [soft yellow] lighting, [minimalist] style.

Start by naming your product and its color to keep AI focused — like, ‘red handbag’ or ‘gold earrings’. Then describe its position (standing, lying, angled), surroundings, background, lighting, and style.

For the background, the description is the same except for the part about the position of your product:

[The product] surrounded by [flowers], [forest] in the background, [soft yellow] lighting, [minimalist] style.

two.question: Who owns the images I generated? Can I use them in ads and promo materials?
two.answer: You own the images you’ve generated, and you can use them for any commercial purposes.

three.question: How long will you keep my projects and images?
three.answer:
We don’t plan to delete them.
Even if you run out of space, you’ll still be able to see your projects and images. If you need to create a new project, you’ll have to delete older ones first.

one.question: What are credits and how do I use them?
one.answer:
Credits are an in-platform currency.
When you join Impacta, you get 10 bonus credits to try out the platform. To get more, you’ll need a promo code.

Every action on Impacta uses credits. Simple actions, like background removal, cost fewer credits. More complex ones, like a product photo shoot, cost more.

Here’s how much each action costs:

  • Removing a background — 0.1 credits
  • Creating a set of 4 images (1 generation) — 1 credit
  • Creating a photo shoot — 50 credits

two.question: I’ve run out of credits. How do I get more?
two.answer:
You can get more credits by using a promo code.
If you're working with an Impacta representative, reach out to them for a new promo code. Let them know what you want to do and how many credits you’ll need. Or, fill in the form in the Contact us section, and we’ll send you one.

one.question: What’s the difference between replacing a background and creating a product photo shoot?
one.answer:
When replacing a background, we remove the background from your uploaded product photo and replace it with anything you describe. Your product stays exactly the same — same color, position, and angle. 
When you create a photo shoot, our AI studies your product photos to understand its shape and details. This allows us to generate images showing your product from different angles and in various settings. For clothing, footwear, and accessories, we can also create lifestyle images where a person is wearing your product.

two.question: I don’t know if I want to replace the background or create a photo shoot. How do I choose?
two.answer:
Both options work — choose based on your needs.

When to use ‘Replace background’:

  • You have a great product photo and just want a new background.
  • You need quick results. Background replacement gives you dozens of images in minutes.
  • You’re looking for inspiration. Try different backdrops and styles to see what works best.

When to use ‘Create product photo shoot’:

  • You need multiple images of your product from different angles.
  • You travel a lot or don’t always have your product on hand. With a product photo shoot, you upload photos of your product once, and then you can create different-looking images with just a description of what you need.
  • You have time to spare. Training our AI can take up to an hour.

three.question: How do you create images of my product in a photo shoot project?
three.answer:
For photo shoot projects, we need 15–20 photos of your product. Our AI studies them to understand your product’s shape and details, creating a 3D model-like reference. 

This process can take up to an hour. When complete, you only need to describe a scene, and we’ll generate new images featuring your product.

four.question: Why does my product look different in the images?
four.answer:
AI is great at creating new images, but consistency can be tricky. It sometimes struggles to keep your product exactly the same in every image, so you may notice small differences. We’re working to improve this.

The accuracy of your product in generated images also depends on the quality of your uploaded photos. Make sure your photos show all angles, include close-ups for small details, and provide scale shots for size reference. Check out our guide How to choose photos for upload for more tips.

rules.2:
We recommend uploading 15–20 high-quality photos from a variety of angles. This way, our AI can create more realistic images.
The photo shoot will cost 50 credits and take about an hour for AI to learn to capture your product details correctly.
